document.docAuthor: Antić, Dragan, Šević, Mirko, Macek, Oliver & Akkari, Nesrine
document.masterDocTitle: Review of Trachysphaera Heller, 1858 (Diplopoda: Glomerida: Glomeridae) in Serbia, with taxonomic notes on the genus

acutula

acutula
, but belong to
acutula

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 7.
Trachysphaera schmidtii Heller, 1858
from Serbia (IZB). A , C , E. Specimens from Petnička Cave. B , D. ♂ from Vrdnik, Fruška gora Mt. F–I. ♂ from Trebljevine, Zasavica. A. ♂, habitus, dorsal view. B. Habitus, dorsal view. C. ♂, habitus, lateral view. D. Habitus, lateral view. E. Juvenile, habitus, lateral view. F. Leg-pair 17, anterior view. G. Leg-pair 18, anterior view. H. Telopods, anterior view. I. Left telopod, posterior view. Scale bars: 1 mm ( A–E ) and 0.2 mm ( F–I ).

FIGURE 8.
Trachysphaera schmidtii Heller, 1858
. A , B , H. ♂ syntype, ex.
Gervaisia costata var. acutula Latzel, 1884
,
syn. n.
, from the Eastern Alps or Carpathians (NHMW MY1822). C , D , E , I. ♂♂, ex.
Gervaisia cultrifera Verhoeff, 1906
,
syn. n.
(NHMW MY1838 and NHMW MY1841), F , G , J. ♂ syntype, ex.
Gervaisia multiclavigera Verhoeff, 1898
,
syn. n.
, from Bosnia and Herzegovina (NHMW MY1865). A , B. Habitus, lateral and dorsal views, respectively. C , D. ♂ syntype from Sabine Mountains (Sabinergebirge), Italy, habitus, lateral and dorsal views, respectively (NHMW MY1838). E. ♂ from Camerata Vec- chia, Italy, habitus, lateral view (NHMW MY1841). F , G. Habitus, lateral and dorsal views, respectively. H.
Gervaisia costata var. acutula Latzel, 1884
,
syn. n.
, telopods, anterior view (NHMW MY1822). I.
Gervaisia cultrifera Verhoeff, 1906
,
syn. n.
, telopods, anterior view (NHMW MY1841). J.
Gervaisia multiclavigera Verhoeff, 1898
,
syn. n.
, telopods, posterior view (NHMW MY1865). Scale bars: 1 mm ( A–G ) and 0.2 mm ( H–J ).

FIGURE 9.
Trachysphaera schmidtii Heller, 1858
, telopods, anterior views (IZB). A. ♂ from Trebljevine, Zasavica, Serbia. B. ♂ from Topčider, Belgrade, Serbia. C. ♂ from Petnička Cave, Serbia. D. ♂ from Buronov Ponor Cave, Serbia. E. ♂ from Džud Pit, Črnomelj, Slovenia. F. ♂ from Jama pri Metliki Pit, Metlika, Slovenia. Scale bars: 0.2 mm.
